stages.text: You are in the gym, training legs, when you suddenly hear a loud scream from the rack next to you. As you look over, you see someone in the middle of a rep squatting 4 plates (180kg), but he suddenly collapses forward and the bar slips down his back before rolling behind him. He is now lying on the floor and appears to be unconscious.

questions.question: What would you do next?
questions.answer: Perform your primary survey: check for response (none), call for help, and check for breathing (he is).

stages.text: The man quickly regains consciousness, and you are able to take some observations and perform a secondary survey (/obs).
obs: S: Headache, thirst, chest pain, dizziness

questions.question: What do you think is the cause of his symptoms?
questions.answer: Possible caffeine overdose. The steroid use could present a long-term health concern but is not particularly relevant in a first aid context.

questions.question: What other course(s) of action would be a good idea?
questions.answer: Inquiring about pain (perhaps with PQRSTA or SOCRATES) and/or performing a head-to-toe survey to identify any injuries that may have been sustained when he fell.

stages.text: Upon performing a head-to-toe survey you find that he has a bit of a graze on the back of his neck (from the knurling of the barbell as it slid down) and a slight bump on his forehead.

questions.question: What would you advise the patient to do next?
questions.answer:
He should probably attend a walk-in centre* to establish the severity of caffeine overdose and receive treatment for it, and ensure that the head injury is not too serious.

*Driven by someone else, due to his dizziness!
